At Shawmut, our primary objective is to deliver exceptional service catered to our clients’ specific goals and concerns. Our project teams deliver top quality work through a hands-on, collaborative process while keeping our clients’ best  interests our absolute focus at all times. With specialized training and the support of a national company, we foster project teams whose skill and dedication leads to the deliberate, predictable and repeatable construction experiences that have attracted and retained the top clients in every market in which we focus. The most memorable construction experiences are based on one principle—it’s the people who make the difference. And at Shawmut, we have the very best.

We are looking for recent or soon-to-be college graduates to be part of our 2019 Construction Management Skills Training (CMST) Program in all of our offices. This unique training program encompasses three twelve-month long rotations in the main areas of construction management: Project Management, Site Supervision, and Estimating. At the end of this intense on-the-job program, trainees graduate and continue their careers dedicated to the role of Assistant Project Manager, Assistant Superintendent, or Assistant Estimator with an understanding of the entire life cycle of a job. 

Project Management
Ensure the proper tools are in place to begin a project
Ensure all documents and materials are maintained throughout a project
Assist with financial management of a project
Assist with the punch list process by coordinating with necessary parties, tracking all items, and distributing lists to all parties
 Site Supervision
Determine constructability of a project
Secure government licenses to start a job
Confirm materials and methods as specified by project documents
Ensure projects are delivered the Shawmut way
Track and manage subcontractor changes and extra work
Keep project plans current and highlight changes

Estimating
Ensure that proper documentation is in place prior to the beginning of the estimating process
Find all necessary information regarding the job to produce a quality estimate
Ensure that the best bids are obtained for each trade based on project needs, and create quantity take-offs for all applicable divisions/trades, beginning with the creation of an accurate list of all trades affected
Assist in the presentation of information and proposals

Bachelors degree or equivalent military experience required, preferably in construction management, civil engineering or a related field
Co-op or internship experience in construction strongly preferred
Strong communication skills
Ability to interact with all levels of management
High attention to detail
Flexibility for national/regional travel

Wood Environment & Infrastructure Solutions is recruiting fulltime or on-call Lead Construction Inspectors to inspect and document project related construction activities for conformance to project plans and ICC/City codes. Candidate may also perform other inspection duties as may relate to our project scopes that may include coordination of other inspection personnel and review of their documentation, and coordination of activities on behalf of client personnel. This position is imminent and qualified candidates are encouraged to apply immediately.
 Key Responsibilities
 The qualified candidate(s) will work at various client construction project sites in the Los Angeles and Orange county areas inspecting and assessing construction activities, office engineer responsibilities and supplementing client staff as necessary
Primary locations may include LAX and City of Inglewood
Must be able to submit professional reports to clients and must have the ability to meet deadlines
Shifts may be standard daytime or off standard shifts such as swing and graveyard

Minimum HS Diploma or equivalent
8 years of construction inspection experience
Licenses or certifications in multiple ICC functions such as structural steel and concrete (Los Angeles Deputy Inspector, DSA and OSHPD certifications are preferred, but not required)
Self-motivated with a proven record of accountability
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
Good computer skills (including MS Office Suite)
Must be able to read plans, specs and technical specifications
Must be able to obtain proper badge
Must pass drug screen and background check
Must pass MVR (driving) check in accordance with operating vehicles on the airfield if needed
Prior experience working on commercial, industrial or airfield buildings preferred
Candidates must be able to obtain proper customs clearance and possess a valid US driver's license in good standing for LAX work
Must be able to perform on your feet throughout the day including a lot of walking and potentially climbing ladders
Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

Wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. We operate in more than 60 countries, employing around 55,000 people, with revenues of around $10 billion.  We provide performance driven solutions throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to decommissioning across a broad range of industrial markets including the upstream, midstream and downstream oil & gas, power & process, environment and infrastructure, clean energy, mining, nuclear and general industrial sectors. We strive to be the best technical services company to work with, work for and invest in. www.woodplc.com

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

Job Description
JOB DESCRIPTION
Key requirements and qualifications for in the Construction Manager / Resident Engineer position:

• Licensed Civil Engineer in the State of California

• A thorough understanding of Southern California Regional Rail Authority (SCRRA) construction practices, American Railway Engineering and Maintenance-of-Way (AREMA) Standards, Federal Railroad Administration (FRA) and California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) regulations governing railroads.

• Has SCRAA experience working with Metrolink or member agencies such as Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority, the Orange County Transportation Authority, the Riverside County Transportation Commission, the San Bernardino Associated Governments, and the Ventura County Transportation Commission or the Southern California Association of Governments, the San Diego Association of Governments, and the state of California.

• Is able to work effectively with engineers, architects, and others involved in the construction process and establish a line of communication with project team members.

• Fifteen (15) years of relevant Construction Manager/Resident Engineer experience that include the following;
o Commuter rail and freight rail construction
o Active railyards and active rail facilities
o Rail Maintenance Facilities

Required Qualifications
 Role and responsibility of the Construction Manager / Resident Engineer position;

• Serves as LA Metro representative on site.

• Responsible for the management, managerial oversight, administration, and coordination of the construction process from the conceptual development stage through final construction on a timely and economical basis.

• Provide constructability review of drawings and specifications throughout the design process relative to LA Metro operations and provide recommendations as to the availability of materials, labor, and construction associated with the subject project.

• Determine that the work of the contractor is performed in accordance with the construction contract, project plans, and specifications, and all other contract documents and amendments thereto to guard against defects and deficiencies in the contractor's work.

• Determines the contractor’s compliance with plans, specifications, schedule, budget, environmental and safety requirements, including but not limited to concrete testing, compaction testing, and other necessary quality-control tests.

• Has the general responsibilities of coordinating and managing people, materials, and equipment, as well as the contractor’s compliance with LA Metro safety policies, and conducting safety assessments as required by the LA Metro Project Manager.

• Shall be responsible for developing the CMC’s Project Safety Plan (PSP), reviewing the contractor's Site Health and Safety Plan and associated Activity Hazard Analyses (AHA), performing site orientation and any other safety training of CMC field staff, periodic monitoring of the project site, and reporting.

• Work with engineers, architects, and others involved in the construction process and establish a line of communication with project team members.

• Notify LA Metro in the event it discovers that any design details may adversely affect the constructability, cost or schedules for the project.

• Many more job details in the attached RFP document

As Managing Director, Construction you will oversee the $1.8 billion LAX Modernization Program. This includes a terminal lobby redevelopment, security checkpoint installations, full development of new centralized Delta Sky Club, concourse redevelopment including concessions coordination, and Delta One reception. Delta has engaged the services of a construction manager and an architect/engineer to support program goals. The Managing Director would be expected to work with and hold these consultants accountable to a successful program outcome.

Your role:

Responsible for design and construction activities needed to meet schedule and budget requirements.
Responsible for meeting the scheduled delivery dates and holding others accountable.
Responsible for maintaining communications with key project stakeholders and to ensure that stakeholders have supplied design input in support of the design schedule and are fully apprised of project status.
Provide weekly and monthly reporting of Program performance, schedule and financials along with corrective action, if necessary, as required to meet key Program goals.
Responsible for working with LAX ACS team to resolve any conflicts with operational impact of the Program.
Participates in problem solving with the airport staff and program consultants to incorporate and plan for future phases as appropriate and determines best path for any subsequent phases to be accelerated or implemented throughout the Program.
Provide the leadership, management and vision necessary to ensure proper organizational controls, reporting procedures and personnel in place to effectively deliver best practice services.
Read, understand and interpret blueprints, drawings, floor plans and schedules as they relate to electrical, mechanical, plumbing, HVAC equipment, and building structures.
Ensure quality deliverables in your projects while meeting agreed-upon time and budgetary restrictions.
Maintain a watchful eye over spending by managing budget controls, scheduling, anticipating, and elevating issues. Cost of escalation is high on this project.


Your background:

20+ years of experience in construction environment. Overseeing large scale, complex commercial redevelopment / construction projects.
Bachelor's or higher degree in construction, engineering, architecture, or a related field
Solid communication and leadership skills to elevate your relationships with contractors and suppliers.
Proven and effective project management, negotiation, procurement, budgeting, and estimating skills.
Creative thinker and analytical problem-solving skills.
Successfully performed high level decision-making in operational management capacity.
Extensive experience in scoping, cost-estimating, budgeting, scheduling and organizing large multi-functional teams (project managers, architects, contractors, consultants and stakeholders). Experience in negotiating construction, contract formats, vendor and similar agreements and contract monitoring.

McMillen Jacobs Associates' has an opportunity for a construction Inspector in our Pasadena office within our Construction Management Practice. The Inspector will work at the owner's office or field trailer in the Los Angeles area primarily on sewer rehabilitation and construction projects.
The successful candidate for this position will have experience in sewer construction, including open-cut trench, pit excavation and shoring; replacement and rehabilitation of pipeline ranging from 8 to 72 inches in diameter through methods such as open-cut, slip lining, pipe bursting, and cured in-place lining (CIPP). Experience with trenchless methods is beneficial.
This position requires the ability to pass all physicals necessary to make field visits and inspections of on-going construction including tunneling under various field conditions.
Responsibilities
Inspect and monitor construction contractor's work and prepare daily inspection reports. Review contractor reports.
Review and provide input into field related Submittals, Requests for Information, Plan Clarifications, geotechnical information and data, and CPM schedules.
Monitor the Contractor's receipt inspection of materials arriving on-site, monitors off-site production activities and/or any other construction activities in his/her area.
Monitor construction work for compliance with Contract Documents.
Enter reports and other data into the agency Construction Management Information System (CMIS) and/or Agency electronic systems.
Qualifications
5 or more years of experience with similar cut-and-cover and/or tunneling for sewer or construction quality assurance/inspection programs. This shall include at least two projects with experience in wastewater conveyance.
Preferred current OSHA 30 Hour Construction Outreach Training or equivalent within the last three years.
Preferred current First Aid and CPR training from a provider recognized by OSHA.
Knowledge of construction-related processes and industry practices
Preferred knowledge of the current Green Book Specifications, the Agency Brown Book, and other code requirements.
Ability to wear personal protective equipment such as a respirator; meet physical demands of the position such as walking standing lifting up to 40 Lbs. climbing ladders, bending squatting, and crawling in tight spaces to safely access work sites.
McMillen Jacobs Associates is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and will make all employment related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY – THIS IS A LOS ANGELES BASED POSITION (Lenax does not pay for relocation or travel expenses for interviews).
Since its inception in 1993, Lenax Construction Services, Inc. (LENAX) has provided quality construction services and project controls to a diverse range of engineering, design, and construction firms. LENAX services a broad range of markets, including airports, transportation, industrial, correctional, universities, and marine. LENAX is a goal-oriented and customer-driven independent consulting business, aimed at adding value and strength to our clients program teams by providing expertise in current pricing and economic trends, while utilizing the most up to date means and methods in the construction and design industries.
LENAX is looking for a Scheduler III (Sr. Scheduler). The Senior Scheduler reports to the Project Manager; and is responsible for providing direct support to the project and Enabling Projects team for the scheduling and stakeholder coordination activities related to the project. The successful candidate will have proven experience scheduling complex, multi-phase, multi-million dollar airport terminal construction and/or renovation projects. The job duties include: Prepares detailed plans and time scaled charts and diagrams; Provides development and analysis of man-hour resources, equipment resources and cost loaded, time-phased schedules; and Promptly reports schedule slippage or other unsatisfactory performance. This position may be assigned as the only Scheduler on one or more smaller projects.
Job Description:
The Senior Scheduler s duties include, but are not limited to the following:
Develop and maintain detailed construction planning schedules for new construction and renovation work, as required. These schedules may incorporate several scenarios used to finalize construction sequencing and contracting plans. Special emphasis will be focused on stakeholder issues for the terminal improvements.
Develop and analyze man-hour resources, equipment resources and cost loaded, time-phased schedules.
Prepare detailed plans and time scaled charts and diagrams
Monitor project progress against an established baseline.
Provide impact analysis of schedule changes, identify schedule variances and opportunities and proactively develop mitigation strategies for the Project Management team.
Maintain simplified logic schedules to highlight status of key interfaces for critical path review.
Review third-party design and/or construction schedules and provide written comments. Participate with third-party schedulers to address the comments.
Provide progress reporting documents and briefing materials as required. Develop creative reporting tools to communicate complex project sequencing and/or progress assessments. Responsible for promptly reporting schedule slip¬page or other variances.
Possesses master schedule system and project interface and integration understanding and appreciation for time frames necessary including BHS, Special Systems, Power, HVAC and other aviation related disciplines.
Perspective for base building core and shell schedule development and timeframe needed for MSC build out successfully merging competing interests. History of successful communicator, collaborator and facilitator.
Job Qualifications:
A Bachelor s degree in Construction Management, Engineering or any related field.
Minimum 10-years scheduling experience, 15 years or more is preferred, with 5-years in direct support of an active construction project, preferably terminal renovation work.
Demonstrated experience scheduling the design and construction of large-scale, complex projects; including developing and managing a progress reporting methodology for a complicated design effort.
Experience with Design-Build and Construction Management at Risk delivery methods is desirable.
Demonstrated ability to understand a demanding, technical and complicated construction program; and the ability to communicate progress and issues to a technical- and management-level audience.
Demonstrated experience with Primavera Project Planner Version 6.0 or higher is required.
Experience with large-scale construction management type software such as Prolog is desirable.
Experience with Time Impact Analysis for claims review is required.
Experience incorporating field information into schedules and creating as-build schedules to measure project progress.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite is required.
Experience with Adobe Acrobat is required.
Ability to work with others, a self-starter with results-driven focus.
Capability to assume additional responsibilities.
Proven accuracy, reliability and completeness in job accomplishment.
Demonstrated success on the job, as evidenced by satisfactory performance, acceptance of responsibility and growth in previous position.
Effective oral and written communication skills, with an ability to communicate complex issues to a non-technical audience.
Demonstrate experience with schedule analysis software.
Airport experience is Highly Desirable.
We prefer LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY. This position is based in Los Angeles, if you are out of the area please let us know if you are willing to relocate.
BENEFITS
HEALTHCARE
DENTAL
401K
8 PAID HOLIDAYS PER YEAR
3 WEEKS OF PTO

ABOUT OPTERRA
 
The world needs energy professionals who see the big picture.  At OpTerra, we offer careers that empower dedicated individuals to work with a dynamic team across many fields – from engineering and sustainable design, to business development, financing, and marketing. If you want to be part of a large, supportive organization where your voice will be heard, join us to power a brighter energy future together. OpTerra is a pioneer in advancing the sustainable energy economy, energizing opportunity and building positive impact for the communities, institutions, and businesses we serve.
 
As a subsidiary of ENGIE, the number one energy efficiency services provider in the world, OpTerra Energy Services provides a unique and extensive set of energy and sustainability management services to thousands of customers across the U.S.  We have helped our partners achieve over $2 billion in energy savings to date while delivering positive environmental and community impact in the diverse regions in which we work.

SUMMARY
The Construction Manager has the primary responsibility of providing oversight and management of daily construction activities on projects asigned to him/her ensuring that all constructable elements found in the implementation contract are properly installed and operational. The Construction Manager shall also be responsible for managing and ensuring that proper start up, commissioning, training obligations are met as stated in the implemenation contract. Additional responsiblities are in summary: create or augment and maintain a Critical Path Schedule, manage oversight of all project safety related concerns, contribute to development of cost and pricing activities prior to and during the project, interact and communicate with the Customer, Project Manager, Project Engineers, subcontractors and all other personnel to ensure responsible and accurate installation of the scope of work.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintain and oversee daily field and safety operations of multiple subcontractors
Conduct on-site meetings and provide progress reports and other status updates with Customer and management as required
Prepare, schedule and communicate the upcoming project and adhere to a critical path schedule
Schedule and conduct regular construction progress meetings with subcontractors to track the construction progress and resolve/prevent potential conflicts and problems
Ensure that subcontractor has met all obligations stated in contract and that all scopes of work and energy measures are functional and working as a system
Drive all job related safety initiatives including development of a job-specific safety plan that includes addressing any unusual job hazards
Coordinate construction pre-bid meetings and walk-throughs with subcontractors, Project Manager and Customer as necessary
Coordinate pre-construction meeting with subcontractors and Customer
Provide assistance to Project Manager on subcontractor selection
Coordinate with the Project Manager on the approval of all submittals received from subcontractors, and distribute to necessary parties
Review and approve/disapprove all invoices from subcontractors, in coordination with the Project Manager
Verify the need for all change orders and determine responsibility and fair price for the work
Provide and/or supervise all training, as required by the contract, to the Customer
Contribute and participate in the job closeout documentation package to ensure that a complete and accurate set of as-built drawings and supporting documentation is prepared, O&M manuals are assembled, warranty certificates assembled, equipment registration
May perform other duties as assigned


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Required:
High School Diploma/ G.E.D
Minimum 5 years of experience
Must be able to read, comprehend and execute on construction plans of all disciplines
Preferred:
Bachelor's Degree
2 - 10+ years of experience


 SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A strong work ethic and high level of craftmanship with a stong attention to detail
Time management and project scheduling skills with the ability to manage multiple task simultaneously
Knowledge of Word, Excel, and Microsoft Project
Must be comfortable with the technical aspect of this job as well and business and Customer interaction
Thorough knowledge of the operation and installation of all or many of the following; mechanical, HVAC, electrical power systems, lighting, controls and solar systems
Sound knowledge of applicable building codes and OSHA safety criteria
Ability to successfully manage projects and maintain high customer satisfaction
Able to lead, motivate and discipline when necessary


 WORKING ENVIRONMENT
Ability to travel  75% - 100%  of the time
Typical field environment with construction trailer and occasional office environment, may be exposed to different weather elements. Must be willing and able to work remotely
Ability to work outdoors and on rooftops
Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printer
Occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc
Frequently communicates with employees and customers
Able to get from office to off site customers
 
 FURTHER INFORMATION
Location: Pasadena, CA (Options for Riverside and Orange)
Hours: Salaried (Exempt)
Reports to: Senior Project Manager

Job_name: Citi Community Capital – Construction Asset Manager - (Job Number: 18045426)
Job_description:
Description
About Citi:
 Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.
 Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.
 Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.

Citi Community Capital – Construction Asset Manager:

Citi Community Capital (“CCC”) is the community lending and investing arm of Citi. It is housed in the Municipal Securities Division of Citi’s Institutional Clients Group. Unique among its peers, CCC provides a comprehensive array of financial products, from investment banking to lending and equity investment, designed to create strong communities and contribute toward Citi’s Community Reinvestment Act performance.

Committed to the communities we serve, CCC finances both straightforward and highly structured transactions for non-profit and for-profit developers, Community Development Financial Institutions, and state and local government agencies.

Our financings may employ a combination of taxable and tax-exempt loans or bonds; Low Income, Historic or New Markets Tax Credits; and government and private subsidies. CCC can provide capital directly or as an intermediary. We are a construction lender and a permanent lender, a Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac mortgage banker, and principal in unique equity investments – all designed to improve neighborhoods, create jobs, or improve the health care services or educational opportunities available to the communities we serve.

The projects we finance serve special needs populations including our nation’s homeless population, seniors and those with disabilities, as well as low income families and individuals. We are the leading investment banker, lender or equity provider in many of the areas in which we participate, and are generally acknowledged to be among the most creative and innovative firms in the industry.

We work throughout the country from 13 offices and have been the #1 affordable housing lender in the United States in each of the past seven years as reported by Affordable Housing Finance magazine. That success is due in large part to having the strongest, most innovative team of professionals in the country. Our work doesn’t just stop when we originate, structure and close a transaction; we have full underwriting, asset management and support groups that analyze and manage our transactions from closing through construction and during the life of the asset or program we’ve financed. Portfolio, risk management and finance professionals ensure that our activities remain within our economic and risk thresholds. With Citi’s capital committing capability and team of experienced professionals, we are able to provide financing solutions that are specifically designed to meet each client’s needs.

CCC is looking to add an experienced professional to join the its Asset management team focused on the construction loan management

Job Responsibilities:
Review, analyze and manage previously closed and new construction loan closings for affordable multifamily developments throughout the United States.
Responsible for confirming the overall sources and uses for new and rehab construction from closing through conversion.
Analyze the availability of the flow of funds during construction as it relates the construction timeline and anticipated construction draws.
Analyze complex capital stacks sources for a project including the nuances of the restrictions and requirements for funding the project costs.
Familiarity with affordable housing projects and the typical debt and equity parties involved in affordable transactions.
Review ongoing monthly construction draws.
Manage and track the progress of lease up and NOI results.
Prepare and present credit recommendations related to loan extensions and modifications for the construction loans.
Externally interact with borrowers, syndicators, legal counsel, and other transaction parties.
Internally interact with the bankers, underwriters, credit and engineering risk and loan administrators.
Contribute to increased loan closings, information flow between departments and management of risks for the CCC investments and construction loan portfolios.

Qualifications
Individual must have excellent communication, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Individual must work well under tight deadlines relating to construction draws and maturing loans.
Candidate is required to have a BA/BS in Finance or Real Estate
Candidate is required to have at least 5 years construction loan management or underwriting experience, preferably in the affordable housing industry.
Candidate has quantitative skills with a high proficiency with Excel and other Microsoft based programs.

Job Responsibilities Must have the ability to lead and direct the performance of field operations for a large volume of non-contract repair and equipment modernizations. Open order sales support, route control, scheduling and quality assurance. Maintaining customer quality assurance; emphasis on safety, improving efficiencies, managing the expenditure of labor, materials and performance to estimate. Ability to coordinate daily activities with the branch’s’ project manager and work well with general contractors, owner’s agency and developers for various modernization sites. Providing technical support. Authorizing change orders.
Qualifications
5+ years of industry experience or construction industry supervisory experience is highly desired ; service field experience is also preferred. Candidates must have excellent communication skills and be able to work in a highly team-oriented and dynamic environment.
Education
High school education required; BA/BS degree preferred or equivalent relevant work experience.
 An EEO employer

Kal Krishnan Consulting Services, Inc. (KKCS), a California Corporation, is a full-service engineering & design, construction management, and program management organization. The firm has grown steadily in size and capability since its founding in 1987, and today employs more than 85 professionals in our regional offices. KKCS has attracted to its staff a full complement of highly experienced, talented, and dedicated professionals who bring a collaborative, integrated team approach to our clients projects.
KKCS experience includes work on rail, airports, ports, freeways, schools, universities, facilities, water, wastewater, bridges, and roadways. Our client list includes federal agencies, state agencies, regional agencies, and private clients. KKCS has broad experience and expertise in engineering design, project management and project controls services.
The KKCS culture is rooted in the ideals of integrity, safety, diversity, and ethical business practices, which is a commitment shared by all KKCS employees throughout our offices and project sites around the country. We have a positive impact on the communities we serve by not only improving infrastructure but also providing service at a relatively low cost to the taxpayer. This allows for more money to be available to the agencies we serve, that inevitably will be reinvested in the community. At KKCS, we value the individual employee and the importance of their contributions toward quality improvement.
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
Company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees
401K retirement plan with company matching contribution
Paid holidays
Paid time off
Company-paid life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) benefits
Company-paid long-term (LTD) insurance
Annual tuition assistance allowance for employees
Employee Assistance Program
Relocation allowance
POSITION DESCRIPTION SUMMARY
KKCS is seeking an experienced, certified electrical engineer to join our team in Los Angeles for full-time, advanced-level opportunities on transit-related projects. The ideal candidate will have expertise in the design-build delivery method, lean principles and Target Value Design plus strong industry-related software skills. This position may assume other duties as required, may work overtime and may be required to work various shifts as needed.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Contributes intimate familiarity and understanding of the contract requirements for the Project, applied fairly to address contract issues between the Client and the Design/Builder.
Applies the contract to assist the Client s team/staff in identifying, understanding, planning and managing the Client s risk on the Project.
Evaluates all design/builder proposals for merit (process adherence, cost validation and time).
Prepares required reports and correspondence.
Attends various meetings including design/builder trade buyout/leveling meetings and change management meetings.
Manages the contract standardization process both with the Design/Builder and client staff.
Monitors all aspects of contract compliance.
Prepares pricing/negotiation strategies for change orders, task orders and potential claims.
Prepares task orders, change orders and potential claims.
Analyzes cost elements in design/builder proposals, change orders and task orders.
Prepares approval recommendations and board reports for management, if required.
Assists in resolving problems and disagreements between the Design/Builder and the Client.
Reviews design/builder documents for contractual compliance.
Conducts closeout actions upon contract completion such as final audit, payment, etc. under the direction of client s personnel.
Contributes to the advancement of departmental goals through commitment to productive collaboration with all stakeholders.
When duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to changes of business necessity.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Required Experience & Abilities:
Ten (10) years of experience in electrical engineering and construction
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite of software, Adobe Acrobat Professional and large-scale construction management-type software such as Prolog, etc.
Bachelor s degree in engineering, construction management or related field
Experience with lean principles and Target Value Design
Effective oral and contract writing skills
Ability to comfortably operate in a face-paced, team-oriented, collaborative work environment
Ability to produce accurate and timely results
Must demonstrate a self-starter attitude with proactive, results-oriented focus, willingness and capability to assume additional responsibilities
Demonstrated success on the job as evidenced by satisfactory performance, acceptance of responsibility and growth in previous positions
Must be detail-oriented and highly organized
Preferred Education & Experience:
Design-Build Institute of America (DBIA) certification preferred
***PLEASE APPLY WITH RESUME***

Join the SPC family and be a part of one of our project teams delivering world-class construction services to such customers as NBC Universal, LinkedIn, Netflix, Omnicom, E Entertainment, Kite Pharma (to name a few). We set up our Superintendents with all the tools needed to succeed and to complete projects to the highest standard. If you are a proactive thinker who is team-work oriented, this is your opportunity to shine with the SPC team.
Key Qualifications
Construction supervisory background with 5 years experience in commercial interiors
Professionally represent SPC as primary field operations interface with the project team
Proven track record of consistently producing quality work and meeting deadlines on high-end commercial construction projects

 Experience
We are seeking an individual who is self-motivated, able to work well in teams but can also work independently. Ideally this candidate has 5-10 years of experience both on and off the job site, dealing with Contractors, Engineers, Planners, and Municipalities. This candidate must also demonstrate a wide breadth of knowledge and experience on various types of construction projects, from industrial business parks, retail shopping centers, to residential subdivisions. Manage planning (i.e. land use, zoning, subdivision, servicing agreements) and engineering for new development projects.
Negotiate Development Agreements with municipalities on new projects (i.e. developer/municipality responsibilities, security agreements, cost sharing agreements).
Direct management of contract work. Obtaining pricing, negotiating contracts, coordinating trades, coordinating utilities, maintaining progress on site and daily action plans for works on site.
Manage budgets, construction costs (changes), scheduling, tenant coordination and daily tasks involved in new projects once construction starts.
Manage land title registration for subdivisions (i.e. review caveats, restrictive covenants, legal document packages) and
Maintain communication with accounting to ensure understanding of construction costs, contracts, budget changes and job costs.
Review and approve all tenant drawings (TI drawings and signage drawings). Complete a final tenant improvement site inspection to ensure base building integrity and to approve release of TI Allowance.
Manage landscaping and surface drainage LOC’s. Ensure engineering group/contractor are following up on LOC’s in a timely manner and ensuring deficient work is complete.
 Duties:
Review & Execute Construction Contracts
Manage Contractor schedule & budget accountability
Assist GC in tender process & subgrade selection
Attend budget, schedule & construction site meeting
Review & Approve Progress Claims.
Manage project scope revisions, Change Orders & additional costs
Assist in post tender costs savings & value engineering.
Provide tenant progress update
Manage job completion, turnover & transition to property management.
Monitor TI construction to protect buildings
Construction Manage occasional site work projects
Head up tenant requirements
Coordinate Design & manage permit process
Tender individual scopes
Award & Execute contracts
Oversee Construction & manage changes
Inspect work
Review & approve progress claims.

Jenkins/Gales & Martinez, Inc. (JGM) has offered a comprehensive array of design and construction - related services to public and private sector clients since its founding in 1981.
Today JGM consists of more than 50 professionals who specialize in program, project and construction management, urban planning and architectural design in the fields of transportation infrastructure, civic, educational, institutional, residential and commercial facilities. ﾠAll of JGM's professional staff is committed to the common goal of providing high-quality services and expertise to our public and private sector clients.
With current projects such as the Crenshaw/LAX Transit Corridor, Westside Subway Extension, LAX-Delta Airlines Terminal Redevelopment, and various others, being a part of the JGM Family allows you the ability to work on some of the most iconic and influential programs in the region.
Job Description
Support management of client projects in Medical, Transportation, and Education fields. Act as Construction Manager overseeing the activities of Assistant Construction Managers, Office Engineers, Assistant Office Engineers, Lead Inspectors, Construction Inspectors, and Administrative/Project personnel. Monitor contractors work for compliance with schedule, Budget, Technical Specifications, and Legal Requirements. Resolve design and field construction problems. Attend progress meetings and reports on project status. Expedite design and field changes. Review contractor requests for change and, when appropriate, assist in the preparation of contract change orders/modifications. Assist the client Contracting Officer in the negotiation of contract changes. Communicate and implement safety rules, policies, and procedures in support of safety vision and goals to contractors and subordinate personnel.
Job Requirements
Bachelor s Degree in Construction Management or Engineering or related field.
Professional architect or engineering license.
Experience with:
At least fifteen (15) years of experience in Heavy Civil Construction with ten (10) years in the construction of Transit, Medical and/or Education Projects.
For transit: Experience as a Resident Engineer or Construction Manager on transit projects of at least $100 million.
For education: DSA Experience
Primavera Experience / P6
Cal-OSHA/OSHA 30 training certification at start of work
Registration as Professional Engineer or Architect is desirable.
CCM Certification is a plus
LEED certification a plus
Benefits
Large selection of medical plans and with a generous employer base plan--HMO, PPO, HSA/EPO options available; Dental, Vision, and Chiropractic/Acupuncture benefits, as well as, additional supplemental insurance offered.
Flexible Spending Account
Life Insurance (paid by JGM)
401K matching
Education Assistance
JGM is a Drug-free Workplace and an Equal Opportunity Employer

Cherne Contracting is one of Kiewit’s oldest districts. Founded in 1916. Cherne is a valuable part of Kiewit and is well known for safety and quality of execution in amazing projects within the oil, gas and chemical sectors. Alone and with other Kiewit districts through internal joint ventures, Cherne not only provides challenges but the stability and career development opportunities expected in a world-class multi-billion dollar organization.
Primary Responsibilities 
•    Assist in interpretation of drawings and specifications for field crews and craft supervision in variety of disciplines depending on experience.
•    Perform quantity calculations by taking measurements and determining percentage of completed/installed materials and work.
•    Assist in the preparation of work plans and work packages.
•    Assist in the preparation of Job Hazard Analysis (JHA’s).
•    Participate in jobsite safety reviews, toolbox meetings, mass safety meetings, and safety training.
•    Assist in compiling, processing, and confirming daily labor timesheets.
•    Plan, schedule, and coordinate work groups on the jobsite.
•    Consult with craft labor to overcome construction impediments and track completed work. 
Qualifications
•    Degree or Apprenticeship in Construction, Engineering, Electrician or equivalent combination of education and experience plus two or more years’ field construction project experience.
•    Ability to read and interpret construction drawings and specifications and to plan work.
•    Working knowledge of computers and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel.
•    Strong written and verbal communications skills.
•    The ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
•    The ability to freely access all points of a construction site in wide-ranging climates and environment.
•    The ability to relocate to construction projects sites as required.
Working Conditions 
•    Fast-paced construction project site environment; must be able to interact effectively project management, staff and craft while simultaneously managing a diversified workload and challenging situations efficiently and effectively; regularly sit, stand, walk and talk and listen; occasionally lift and move up objects up to 30 pounds.
About Kiewit 
As one of North America's largest, most respected construction and engineering organizations, with 2017 revenues of $8.7 billion, Kiewit exists to make a difference. We improve and connect communities across the United States, Canada, and Mexico through complex projects in transportation, water/wastewater, power, oil, gas and chemical, building, industrial and mining. Our services are as diverse as the skills of our 22,000-strong workforce to whom we provide challenging, honest work in a caring and collaborative culture. A sense of adventure, pride and fulfillment is built into every career at Kiewit.
How We’re Different
•    Consistently ranked within the top five of the “Top 400 Contractors” according to Engineering News-Record 
•    Top-tier health, dental and vision insurance available from Day One of employment
•    401K savings plan that includes company dollar-for-dollar match on contributions up to 6 percent of base pay
•    Our employees are entitled to accrue at least 20 days paid time off each year
•    We spend an average of $8,500 per employee each year on training and career development and reimburse up to $5,250 per year in outside tuition costs
Kiewit is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

DHS Consulting, Inc. is a rapidly growing, California-based consulting firm; alongside our talented professionals, we are dedicated to providing Program, Project and Construction Management services to our clients with offices in Central and Southern California.   
Our mission is clear. We help clients solve challenges by providing top talent to develop the right solutions at the right time. With forward thinking and utilization of the most advanced technology on the market, we’re leaders in project management strategy and execution; providing the visibility our clients want to see. Our relationships are built on our credibility to deliver on our commitments, with unbeatable service levels to our clients, at DHS; we let our work product lead the way.
As a result of the work that we have recently won, we are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Construction Manager III (College Facilities) to join our team in our growing Buildings division in the Los Angeles area. In this role, you will manage and provide construction projects.
**This opportunity will be located at the Downtown Los Angeles office. (Company office is in El Segundo)  
Responsibilities  
Manages, oversees and coordinates all facets of the construction phase of a college facility project including mobilization, construction, and closeout
Plans, organizes, directs and reports construction management activities and progress to upper management
Coordinates with public agencies during construction to comply with off-site work
Manages both the project budget and schedule to meet the District’s qualitative standards
Performs day-to-day contract administration including assisting the Senior Project Managers in bid analysis, pre-construction meetings and related award coordinating activities
Reviews contractors’ initial construction schedule, submittals, schedule of values, and responds to contractor inquiries
Manages and coordinates project team and contractors in communicating directives and ensuring the project scope is built according to plans, specifications, and cost limits
Reviews submittals from contractors to ensure specification requirements are met
Obtains responses to requests for clarification from contractors and keeps a log of such requests
Negotiates with contractors to achieve a fair and reasonable cost for change orders and reviews their impact on the project Reviews applications for payment, and performs fiscal management of project resources
Coordinates District delivery of related fixtures, furniture and equipment
Perform other Construction Management functions as assigned
Experience with a $60M-$100M Public Works construction projects
Experience with major hazardous material remediation projects
Qualifications 
8 years’ experience in Construction Management of Commercial and/or Public Facilities, preferably including Educational Facility Construction
BS or BA in Architecture, Engineering, Urban Planning, Construction Management or a closely related field.
OR
8 years’ experience in Construction Management of Commercial and/or Public Facilities, preferably including Educational Facility Construction.
4 years additional qualifying experience in excess to the minimum stated above may be substituted for the required education.
Experience utilizing Building Information Modeling (BIM) (Preferred)
Experience with Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) certified projects and/or the Collaborative for High Performing Schools (CHPS) (Preferred)
Experience with Division of the State Architect (DSA) construction/design processes(Preferred)
A valid Certificate of Registration as a Professional Engineer or licensed Architect in the State of California (Preferred) or
A valid Certified Construction Manager (CCM) credential by the Construction Manager Certification Institute (CMCI) (Preferred)
We offer a competitive total compensation package including comprehensive health coverage, 401k and more!

Applicants are considered for positions without regard to veteran status, uniformed service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. DHS will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of the LA Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.

POSITION SUMMARY:
Responsible for overseeing, managing, and supervising all cable TV new plant, upgrade, and rebuild construction activities and personnel as well as outside contractor involvement.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
•Responsible for project cost, departmental expenses, and contractor invoices.
•Formulates construction capital and expenses budgets including cost analysis.
•Collaborates with other departments to ensure that a good flow of communication occurs regularly.
•Communicates with warehouse manager to ensure proper flow of materials needed for construction activities.
•Provides coaching, counseling, disciplinary actions, and performance reviews for direct reports.
•Promptly and accurately provides necessary weekly, monthly, and production reports.
•Serves as a liaison between government officials, public utilities, and private contractors in order to secure clearance and permits for system construction. Recognizes and enforces safety rules and procedures.
•Evaluates various contracting companies and oversees the bidding of yearly contracts for plant upgrade, generic bids, and conduit supply and installation including price negotiation and final selection.
•Reviews and approves project authorizations and department correspondence including letters, memos, joint trench agreements, aerial attachment applications, and encroachment permits.
•Oversees and manages all work performed by outside construction contractors.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
•High School Diploma or equivalent required.
•Must possess two to three years of construction supervisory or management experience.
•Must possess knowledge of departmental and capital budgeting and cross-communication flow between departments.
•Must possess thorough knowledge of General Orders 95 and 128, power and RF activation, troubleshooting, and cable technology.
•Must possess knowledge of CADD systems. Must possess strong computer skills including working knowledge of spreadsheets, databases, word processing, and presentation software. Windows-based software skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Access) is preferred.
•Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience preferred.
•Must be proficient in project tracking, contractor invoicing, and CATV design.
•Driving is a requirement for this position. Must possess and maintain a valid Driver's License and safe driving record.
Note: This Job Summary should not be construed, to be all inclusive lists of all responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with a job. While the description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the job requirements, management reserves the right to modify, add, or remove duties and to assign other duties as necessary.

• Adhere to and support Fluor's Health, Safety & Environmental and Sustainability Policies
• Implement the site safety and security procedures and project work rules
• Play an active role in the development of the safety culture on the project, making safety a natural part of all work performed
• Remain knowledgeable of safety policies and procedures and perform assigned duties in a safe manner and, while supervising others, has responsibility for their safety and confirm that they comply with established safety policies and procedures and practice safe work habits
• Assure that all requirements and expectations of the Fluor Operating System Requirements (OSR), appropriate Operating System Implementation Plan (OSIP), and strict adherence to other business line requirements
• Support on-site management, supervision and coordination of all self-performed and subcontracted work. Identify resource requirement of project and support the same.
• Control project schedule and cost through the efficient use of all construction resources including manpower, materials, tools, and equipment
• Provide input for the development of project schedules in cooperation with the construction engineers and planners
• Review design scope and approach with regard to Constructability and submit recommendations for change
• Participate in HSE audits at construction site.
• Develop construction execution plan for project and define construction methods to be followed.
• Assist in the overall administration of labor relations policies.
• Develop sub-contracting plans for the project. Manage the contractual commitments of contractors, including cost, quality, and schedule and coordinate their field activities
• Plan and manage to estimate the project’s temporary facilities
• Analyze situations, identify and forecast existing problems and evaluate realistic options; recommend/implement appropriate course of action
• Organize and prioritize a variety of complex projects and multiple tasks in an effective and timely manner, set priorities, and meet critical time deadlines

ANCILLARY ACCOUNTABILITY'S:

• Administer, train, and motivate all personnel in construction operations , superintendent and supervisor levels.
• Typically manage personnel and provide an environment for the development and professional advancement of staff members, including on-the-job and formal training and development opportunities, and timely performance feedback
• Identify resource requirements and support staffing needs.
• Maintain compliance with all applicable policies, procedures, and global standards
• Promote professional image of the Company’s operations and maintain harmonious relationship with the Client and their representative.
• Maintain positive working relationship with contractors, suppliers and other employees.
• Ensure that Site organization discipline is appropriately maintained.
• Any other duties which may be assigned by the Site Management.

Project Manager - Construction
Job Summary
Project Managers serve as a single point of contact for the client. His or her responsibilities include developing and maintaining a strong working relationship with client. Successful project planning, coordination and construction of medium to large scale projects. The Project Manager shall demonstrate the ability to plan work and manpower accordingly to meet the project schedule. The PM is responsible for the execution the assigned scope of work by delivering on contractual commitments and financial targets for the assigned project, including providing day-to-day direction to employees.
II. Duties and Responsibilities
Essential Functions
Work drug and alcohol free including medications that may affect job performance and safety.
Prepare estimates and/or change orders
Negotiate with subcontractors and vendors, pre-contract
Prepare and manage the baseline schedule
Prepare and manage the schedule of values
Ensure that all customer-required documentation is maintained and submitted
Generate, submit and document RFI’s, change orders and earned value reports
Maintain all logs; RFI’s, change orders, transmittal’s and earned value reports
Assist Manager in identifying and pricing work that is out of contract scope
Update schedule weekly and communicate any problems to Construction Manager
Initiate monthly A/R directive
Track all cost, man-hours and billings and submit report to Construction Manager bi-weekly
Attend all required client meetings
Lead daily safety meetings and ensure employee attendance
Assure quality control is being performed. Implement standards and abide by corresponding procedures. Ensure that all documentation is filed and submitted in a timely manner
Attend all job kickoff and closeout meetings
Oversee subcontractors to ensure compliance, approve billing and payments including extras; draft subcontract agreements and submit to Construction Manager for approval
Identify job site safety hazards and prepare safe work procedures
Periodic Functions
Interview potential employees and participate in hiring process
Provide employee evaluation and performance reviews
Administer disciplinary action when necessary
III. Reporting Relationships
Reports to Construction Manager and/or Group President’s with indirect reporting to the owner of the facility.
IV. Education and Qualifications
Education and Experience
Bachelor of Science of applicable discipline, High school diploma, Minimum 5 years’ verifiable experience as a Project Manager or 10 years’ experience as an assistant Project Manager and/or Superintendent with heavy industrial supervision experience.
Must possess current TWIC, RSO and CA driver’s license card
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Read, speak and understand safety instructions, rules and regulations in English
Superior oral and written communication skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office, Projects, Primavera and other standardized industry software
Exceptional communication and collaborative skills
Strong project management skills
Work up to 16 hours per shift
Available to work evenings, nights and weekends
Wear and use properly fitted safety equipment, to include respiratory protection
Ability to work independently
Ability to travel and work out of town as needed

The Role
We are looking for a highly motivated individual to support the Supercharger deployment team in California and the western United States.  This person must have a construction background; general contractor’s experience is highly valued. The role will oversee multiple construction projects and enforce budget, timeline, fit, finish, and safety requirements. A get-it-done mentality for all situations is expected.
  Responsibilities
Get the most world-class Supercharger sites built in the shortest amount of time for the least amount of money.
Provide related feedback to the deployment, development, and engineering team on how to design equipment and sites for better/faster/cheaper site builds. Help design and implement those improvements.
Coordinates the timely processing and approvals of all shop drawings to and from subcontractors and architects/engineers.
Coordinate with Project Managers to timely process change requests and change orders
Distribute drawing and design revisions, bulletins, etc. to Project Manager, Super and all trades.
Communicate effectively, both orally and written. Prepare weekly construction reports with photos, schedule, etc.
Expedites project close-out requirements including municipal sign offs, as-built drawings, final project photos, etc.
Maintain a high level of productivity. Balance a large number of concurrent tasks. Effectively prioritize efforts.
Foresee necessary work, and organize and disseminate information as needed. Maintain project schedules.
  Requirements
Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture or a related subject and 4-6 years of increasingly responsible estimating and project management experience, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
Thorough understanding of construction administration processes, including contracts, budgets, construction documents, change orders, schedules, RFIs, submittals, and material procurement.
Advanced knowledge of construction means and methods
Strong understanding of AC and DC power, transformers, circuit protection, single-line electrical and mechanical diagrams, and construction drawings.
Excellent written and spoken English. Must have the ability to discuss technical topics with a variety of audiences – contractors, engineers, and members of various divisions within Tesla.
Class A general contractor’s license a plus but not required
Available for extensive travel (50%+), often on short notice.
Ability to obtain an U.S. passport.
Must have valid driver’s license and clean driving record

Responsibilities Get the most world-class Supercharger sites built in the shortest amount of time for the least amount of money. Provide related feedback to the deployment, development, and engineering team on how to design equipment and sites for better/faster/cheaper site builds. Help design and implement those improvements. Coordinates the timely processing and approvals of all shop drawings to and from subcontractors and architects/engineers. Coordinate with Project Managers to timely process change requests and change orders Distribute drawing and design revisions, bulletins, etc. to Project Manager, Super and all trades. Communicate effectively, both orally and written. Prepare weekly construction reports with photos, schedule, etc. Expedites project close-out requirements including municipal sign offs, as-built drawings, final project photos, etc. Maintain a high level of productivity. Balance a large number of concurrent tasks. Effectively prioritize efforts. Foresee necessary work, and organize and disseminate information as needed. Maintain project schedules. Advanced knowledge of construction means and methods Strong understanding of AC and DC power, transformers, circuit protection, single-line electrical and mechanical diagrams, and construction drawings. Construction Project Admin

Location: El Segundo, CA
Duration: 12 Months

Description:
Directs construction of contract strategy and approves contracts for high-impact projects. Evaluates contractor proposals for fair and reasonable cost. Administers contractor activities. Participate in contractor selection, contract change negotiations, constructability reviews, and cost/schedule visibility such as management, customer and contractor reviews to ensure compliance with standard operating procedures. Oversees and lends technical expertise to less experienced employees. Directs and integrates high-impact facilities projects. Obtains facilities design and resources commitments. Develops work package that can include budget/funding source, schedule, drawings, specifications, statement of work, procurement, estimates. Coordinates with affected parties such as customer, designers, SHEA, crafts, Security, and network infrastructure to create an agreed to implementation plan. Assembles and releases work package by collecting and integrating various individual documents such as facilities work order, contract service request, drawings, vendor quotes, schedule, permits. Finalized work package will provide documents to implement the project. Oversees and lend technical expertise to less experienced employees. Evaluates requests and meet with customer to define requirements for high-impact projects. Identifies acceptable options with customer to clarify needs and develop the preliminary scope of work in order to meet the customer's requirements. Creates layouts and conceptual designs. Ensures compliance with client and regulatory standards such as city, county, state, federal. Develops options so that facilities modifications are accomplished within project objectives. Works with affected parties to define functionality and constructability. Develops conceptual, budgetary, and detailed cost estimates to assist in the business case analysis. Negotiates options with customer to select the best solution for customer and company. Oversees and lends technical expertise to less experienced employees. Directs and ensure completion and retention of records for high-impact projects by following the standard operating procedure for closure and update of appropriate documents, forms, permits, work management systems, commissioning and as-built drawings. Ensures comprehensive closeout and retention of project and contract files to provide an audit trail for Records Retention, Internal Audit, Internal Revenue Service, Property Accounting, Legal, and Facilities. Oversees and lend technical expertise to less experienced employees. Directs and integrates high-impact project implementation activities such as relocations, construction, utility shutdowns, budget management, schedule, and project reviews. Coordinates support functions such as vendors, security, fire, SHEA, network infrastructure and verifies compliance with project documents. Ensures that project implementation meets established quality, cost, schedule targets and regulatory requirements. Oversees and lend technical expertise to less experienced employees. Receives customer requests for high-impact facilities projects, such as construction, rearrangements, moves, and asset acquisition, via various electronic methods. Validates against acceptance criteria for new requests and acknowledges customer requests. Assigns priorities and logs request into work management system in order to document, track, and perform work.

Education / Experience:
Bachelor's degree and typically 10 or more years' related work experience, a master's degree and typically 8 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. AutoCAD skills desired.

We are hiring Construction Drivers which includes dump trucks, mixer trucks, asphalt rollers and fuel trucks, to represent Centerline and our clients in a professional manner, while maintaining a strong commitment to safety.

PRIMARY PURPOSE:
This position is accountable for the planning, organization, scheduling, budgeting and execution of 4 to 5 assigned new regular retail mall development and/or mall renovation projects on a timely basis and within budget.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
The successful candidate’s responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
The following responsibilities are project specific and dependent.  These activities may or may not be delegated to subordinate staff for actual action and/or follow-up with final reporting being through the Project Manager:
Participates in project planning with Developer responsible for project as dictated by demands of the project; contributes to site planning, preliminary building design, prospective project budgeting and scheduling.
Coordinates final project design scope with in-house and outside architects and engineers.
As needed, negotiates with zoning and city planning officials, owners of adjoining properties, utilities and city, state and federal government agencies in order to gain cooperation, commitments, proper zoning and easement changes, etc.
Prepares, obtains approval of and monitors actual construction budgets inclusive of related soft costs; oversees and identifies budget revisions and reports status to Developer.
Prepares or delegates preparation of requests for bids; obtains and reviews bids; recommends outside architects, engineers and contractors for approval; negotiates contract terms.
Monitors and controls progress of projects; manages activities of general contractor of sub-contractors for each project through SPG Field Superintendent and/or Project Coordinators.
Develops and insures compliance with schedule; insures compliance with specifications;
Coordinates and negotiates responsibilities and activities with major tenants and/or department stores.
Approves change orders or negotiates changes with contractors; may delegate approval of routine change orders.
Reviews draw requests and insures completion of specific work; approves invoices for payment.
May have on-site subordinate staff to help facilitate process with proper delegation.
Interfaces on-site tenant construction through Tenant Coordinators.
Contracts:
The incumbent has frequent contact with Development personnel who establish broad design and budget parameters.
Obtains the expertise and recommendations of Engineering, Architecture and Technical Services personnel.  
Negotiates with contractors and various government entities, major tenants and regulatory agencies as applicable.  
Coordinate development of tenant construction specifications and approval of tenant plans and schedules, the incumbent provides direction to tenants (tenants include department stores, big boxed, jr. anchors, etc…).
Other:
The incumbent is accountable for the design and construction process of projects while using the expertise of internal and external personnel.  While budget, schedule and choice of general contractors must be approved, responsibility for completing the project within those parameters lies with the incumbent.
The major challenges of this position are coordination of many aspects of multiple projects and managing the activities of general contractor, subcontractors, engineers, architects and other personnel not directly associated with SPG. 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Performance of duties of this position requires extensive knowledge of high-rise construction management, including site work, structural, mechanical and architectural considerations, electoral distribution and other utilities, landscaping and paving.  
Well-developed interpersonal skills are required.  
Knowledge of budgeting, cost estimating and supervisory skills are necessary.  
Normally, the required background is obtained through attainment of a B.S. degree in Architecture, Engineering or Building Services (Construction Management)
10 or more years of construction management experience or the equivalent.

Tuff Shed is recruiting for an experienced Shop Supervisor to contribute to the success of our Factory Store in Anaheim. This role offers the opportunity to make a real impact to the Company.
DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO BE A SUCCESSFUL SHOP SUPERVISOR?
- Coordinates and schedules all fabrication assignments (Truss Assembly, Framing, Painting, etc..)
- Ensures work is properly assigned and completed with Tuff Shed's quality, productivity, and safety specifications
- Ensures that all products are assembled according to customer instructions
- Maintains material inventory and ensures that company vehicles meet safety standards
- Liaises with General Manager on issues including organization, shortage, and unnecessarywaste
- Ability to operate standard construction equipment, such as power and pneumatic tools, as well as measuring devices
- Outstanding safety record in construction preferred
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
- Minimum of two years of experience in construction / manufacturing, as well as experience with power and pneumatic tools.
- Experience supervising a team and meeting deadlines. Inventory and safety supervision experience preferred
- PC skills, including Word, Excel, and Outlook
- Must possess a current valid driver's license and an acceptable Motor Vehicle Report.
- Must successfully pass a criminal background check and drug screen
What's in it for you?
As a Tuff Shed Shop Supervisor, you'll have the opportunity to join a successful company, and be part of the growth team! We offer a competitive salary and benefits including paid vacation, paid holidays, medical/dental/vision and life insurance, and a 'Safe Harbor' 401(k) plan.
ABOUT TUFF SHED
Founded on an entrepreneurial spirit and an unwavering commitment to quality, Tuff Shed was established in 1981, and has since developed into America's largest manufacturer and installer of storage buildings and garages, having built nearly one million buildings for satisfied customers. We utilize cutting edge green technology in our materials and manufacturing processes, hold multiple U.S. Patents, and are an approved GSA vendor.
NEXT STEPS:
- Learn more about us! Check out the Tuff Shed Website at www.tuffshed.com Interested?
- Interested? We encourage you to submit an application for consideration
Tuff Shed, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran.

Company:
CableCom is a leading provider of engineering, construction, and testing services for coaxial and fiber optic cable systems. With headquarters in Bothell, Washington, just outside of Seattle, we have 20 locations throughout the Western Region of the US. Founded in 1978, CableCom is a subsidiary of Dycom Industries – one of the largest telecommunication infrastructure companies in the U.S., with approximately 14,000 employees and over 40 subsidiaries.
Every day at CableCom, we work to improve the way information is shared and communicated through the execution of innovative technology projects. Join us in Anaheim, California where you can be a part of a team dedicated to providing world class customer service.
Overview:
CableCom is seeking an experienced, full-time Underground Construction Supervisor who will lead a team for our Anaheim , California location.  Successful candidate must have experience in underground utility work and specializes in telecommunication construction. Candidate must be capable of working in all temperatures, climates, and weather conditions and be able to pass a background check and drug screen. We offer competitive pay and an extensive benefits package.
Responsibilities:
Supervise all operations to ensure that all construction operations are completed in accordance with customer and industry specifications. This includes ensuring that all employees working on project are working safely and productively.
Provide OJT training for employees working under your direction on construction practices and methods to ensure a safe and productive work environment.
Assign daily production to in-house and subcontract laborers and crews.
Requisition, assign and track materials needed for the daily operations.
Perform audits of construction operations to ensure work is being completed in compliance with project specifications and monitor safe work practices.
Resolve complaints with property owners in areas where our personnel are working.                                       
Review daily production reports, material usage sheets, keep track of work hours, complete and maintain accurate "as-built maps" for areas built.
Reconcile all issued parts and materials on a daily basis to ensure accurate material usage counts.
Verify submitted Daily Production Reports for accuracy and approve recorded production for billing purposes.
Willingness to work shifts as assigned, including daily overtime when necessary.
Provide verifiable evidence of experience in CATV construction field and prior supervisory experience in construction or related field.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Possess a valid driver’s license (class "C" minimum) or be eligible and willing to obtain the required license for the position (possibly class "B" - light commercial)
Capable of working in all temperatures, climates, and weather conditions.
Able to perform the physical tasks required in this position for the entire assigned shift.
Standing - 6 to 8 hours daily
Walking - 4 to 6 hours daily
Climbing - 0 to 2 hours daily
Driving - 0-4 hours daily
Bending/Twisting - 0 to 2 hours daily
Pushing/Pulling - 0 to 2 hours daily
Repetitive Motion (grasping, manipulation) - 0 to 2 hours daily
Lifting (weights up to 100 lbs.) - rarely
Lift & Carry (weights of 50 to 60 lbs.) – occasionally
Must be able to pass background and drug screening.
Benefits Include:
Competitive Pay
Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Plans
Flexible Spending Accounts
Retirement Savings Plan (401K) with company matching
Stock Purchase Plan
Short & Long Term Disability
Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance
Paid Holidays and Vacation (PTO)
Educational Reimbursement
If you are interested in learning more about our organization, please visit our website www.cablecomllc.us
